gmx:name.gco:CharacterString: Feature catalog for 1:1,000,000-Scale Streams of the United States, 2014

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A linear water feature in the United States, Puerto Rico, or the U.S. Virgin Islands
Internal feature number.

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A polyline is a 1-dimensional element that may or may not surround a 2-dimensional element. A polyline ZM is a polyline feature that can store elevation (Z) values and distance measurement (M) values for each vertex.

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A structure designed to transport domestic or industrial water from a supply source to a distribution point, often by gravity.

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: An artificial open waterway constructed to transport water, to irrigate or drain land, to connect two or more bodies of water, or to serve as a waterway for water craft.

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A system of rivers, canals, and designated channels along the Atlantic and Gulf Coasts of the United States.

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The 2-letter Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS) code for the State or State equivalent in which the water feature is located. If the water feature falls in two States, both codes are listed, separated by a hyphen.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The 2-digit FIPS code for the State in which the water feature is located. If the water feature falls in two States, both codes are listed, separated by a hyphen.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The 2-digit Hydrologic Unit Code for major river basins. Leading zeroes are not shown.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A unique identifier for the 'reach' of the stream. The first eight digits are the Watershed Boundary Dataset 8-digit Hydrologic Unit Code, which identifies the subbasin in which the stream is located. The next six digits are randomly assigned, sequential numbers that are unique within a subbasin, resulting in a 14-character value. This attribute links features back to the National Hydrography Dataset, National Hydrography Dataset Plus, and other data sets that use reach codes.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: No reach code was available in the source data.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString:
A value that uniquely identifies each feature in the Medium-Resolution NHD, NHDPlus Version 1, and NHDPlus Version 2 NHDFlowline data. The ComID also corresponds to the Permanent_Identifier in the High-Resolution NHD NHDFlowline data for Alaska, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands (unless an NHDFlowline feature is updated and assigned a new value for its Permanent_Identifier).
This attribute links 1:1M features to feature classes and attribute tables in the NHD and NHDPlus datasets. Because many features were split during the creation of the 1:1M data, there may be multiple features with the same value.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: There is no ComID because the stream did not come from the NHD or NHDPlus.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The unique from-node identifier. It represents the upstream end of a stream segment.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The unique to-node identifier. It represents the downstream end of a stream segment.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: An indication of whether a feature can participate in a geometric network.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: Not enabled. In the geodatabase, this value is shown as False.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: Enabled. In the geodatabase, this value is shown as True.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A number representing the order of the stream using the Strahler stream-order classification system, in which first-order streams have no tributaries, second-order streams begin at the confluence of two first order streams, third-order streams begin at the confluence of two second-order streams and so on. If a lower-order stream flows into a higher-order stream, the stream order of the higher-order stream does not increase.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Dingman, S.L., 2002, Physical Hydrology, 2nd Ed.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Dingman, S.L., 2002, Physical Hydrology, 2nd Ed.

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The feature is not part of the stream network and is outside the coastline.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The feature is not part of the stream network and is inside the coastline.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The length of the stream segment in miles, calculated using the North America Albers Equal Area Conic projection.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Global Map Specifications Version 2.1

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Global Map Specifications Version 2.1

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A pipe or artificial channel designed to transport water from a remote source, usually by gravity. A man-made or improved natural waterway used for transportation. An open, inclined channel which carries water for use in such operations as mining or logging. A pipeline or channel generally used by hydroelectric plants or water mills to transport water by gravity or under pressure.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Global Map Specifications Version 2.1

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A natural flowing watercourse (from origin to end point).
